plant.description: Succulent shrub with a swollen trunk (caudex) and vibrant trumpet-shaped flowers.

toxins.name: Cardiac Glycosides
toxins.description: Cardioactive steroids that inhibit the Na+/K+ ATPase pump, leading to increased intracellular calcium and severe cardiac arrhythmias.
toxins.concentration_notes: Present in all parts including the toxic sap.

symptoms.name: Cardiac Arrhythmias
symptoms.notes: Bradycardia, tachycardia, heart block; can result in sudden death.

symptoms.name: Hyperkalemia
symptoms.notes: High potassium levels due to pump inhibition.

treatments.name: Decontamination
treatments.description: Induce vomiting and activated charcoal (multiple doses).
treatments.notes: For asymptomatic patients; avoid if cardiac signs present.

treatments.name: Digoxin-specific Fab Fragments
treatments.description: Specific antidote to neutralize cardiac glycosides.
treatments.notes: Use if available for severe toxicity.
